activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sara J Horton

records.addlTxt:
1:10 PM 2022CF000107, 2022CF000127, 2022CM000117, 2022CM000118 - Defendant Sara J Horton in court.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun in court for Sara J Horton.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.

2022CM000117, 2022CM000118 - Max penalties stated. Attorney Dadoun waives the formal reading and enters a NG plea.

2022CF000107, 2022CF000127 - Max penalties stated. Attorney Dadoun waives the formal reading. Attorney Dadoun waives the time limits for the preliminary hearing. SH agrees with waiving the time limits of a preliminary hearing. 

Attorney Harper states that there is a motion to forfeit bond in all the cases except for 22CF127. Court sets a motion hearing re: forfeiting bond. Court sets motion hearing for 11/09/22 at 2:30 PM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:15 AM 22CM117, 22CM118, 22CF107, 22CF127 -  Defendant Sara J Horton in court.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun in court for Sara J Horton.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Dadoun ask for another date due to just getting the complaint in 22CF127. Court resets.

Attorney Dadoun asks about the motion to forfeit bond. Attorney Harper states that the motion has been filed but doesn't believe that it can be done today before the conviction.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

All conditions of all other  bonds will apply and continue to the end of the cases.

11:35 AM Defendant Sara Horton appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Dadoun appears in person. Attorney Harper appears in court. Attorney Harpers speaks about the history of the defendant.. State request a $3,000 cash bond. Attorney Dadoun has spoken with SH and notes that SH was confused about the multiple bonds. Attorney Dadoun asks for a signature bond. Discussion between the parties. 

Attorney Harper states that she will be motioning to forfeit bail in the prior cases.

Court orders $500 cash bond. Conditions of Bond: Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

All conditions of all other bonds will apply and continue to the end of the cases.

Initial set for 09/19/22 at 11 AM
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
